benchmark_details.name: UTQA (Undergraduate Thermodynamics Question Answering)
benchmark_details.overview: UTQA is a 50-item undergraduate thermodynamics question answering benchmark, covering ideal-gas processes, reversibility, and diagram interpretation, aimed at evaluating LLM competence in thermodynamics.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate large language models' capabilities in reasoning and tutoring in undergraduate thermodynamics.

data.source: Developed by experts based on thermodynamics curriculum.
data.annotation: Expert-reviewed and tested for clarity and correctness.

methodology.calculation: Mean accuracy calculated across multiple runs.
methodology.interpretation: Scores indicate the fraction of correctly answered items.
methodology.baseline_results: Top-performing LLMs achieved up to 82% accuracy.
methodology.validation: Peer-reviewed methodology and testing across various models.
